sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph G:

![Graph G](https://i.imgur.com/lM9jZJE.png)

What is the chromatic index of G?
message_2:
The chromatic index of a graph is the smallest number of colors needed to color its edges such that no two adjacent edges share the same color. This graph is a simple cycle with 7 vertices, which is an odd number.

For odd cycles, the chromatic index is equal to the maximum degree of the graph (which is 2 in this case). Therefore, the chromatic index of G is 2.
